Node.definition: = exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation
= causative action by which humans prescribe patterns of behavior required from other humans under their authority
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= causative action by which humans create a written document, such as a letter, book, or song
= causative action by which humans create a written document, such as a letter, book, or song
literally: to turn (someone) away; hence: = action by which humans or deities show their unwillingness to help (other) humans

= the act of giving a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: destruction; hence: = an event that has a great negative impact on one's life, possessions and well being

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
= particle marking a proposition as not true|= particle marking a proposition as the only condition for another proposition to be true
= process by which humans or animals sink on their knees ◄ as a result of being unable to keep standing up
usually used as collective: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies

Node.gloss: to turn away|to come to an end|to cease|to subside
Node.definition: literally: (an event) turns away (from someone); hence: = process by which a certain condition comes to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
literally: to stretch out (one's) arm; hence: = action by which deities prepare to punish to humans
= exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
literally: stick, rod; hence: = a group that oppresses other people
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= nation that oppresses other people
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= causative action by which deities commission one or more people to go to a certain individual or place to inflict punishment
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= stiff tenacious earth; ► material of which bricks, pottery, and even man himself is made; ≈ buildings made with this material are regarded as relatively weak as opposed to buildings made of stone; therefore it is also seen as relatively worthless material
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to cut off (people); hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans to die a violent death

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= small quantity of objects or substance

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= town; ◄ on the Euphrates (פְּרָת) ► location where Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר) defeated the Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) and the Egyptians (מִצְרַיִם)
= town; ◄ in Syria (אֲרָם) near Arpad (אַרְפַּד) and Aleppo

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= town; ◄ in N Syria (אֲרָם) ► conquered by Assyria (אַשּׁוּר)
= town, area; ◄ on Orontes river in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of Aramean (אֲרַמִּי) kingdom; its inhabitants were relocated to Samaria (שֹׁמְרֹון) by the king of Assyria (אַשּׁוּר)

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= town; ◄ in Syria (אֲרָם) ► capital of one of the Aramaean (אֲרָם) kingdoms

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
literally: (one's) hand finds (something); hence: = state in which humans have the financial means to acquire something
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom

= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= a causative process by which deities or humans bring a process to its end by completing it in its entirety
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
literally: to bring down; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to lose their power or social status
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
literally: (one's) hand finds (something); hence: = state in which humans have the financial means to acquire something
= structure, made by birds ◄ from twigs, straw, grass, or other materials, ► to lay their eggs and shelter their young; ≈ associated with security
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= an oval or round object coming from the body of a female bird or reptile and containing an ovum which, if fertilized, can develop into a new organism; ≈ appreciated as food
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= action by which animals move their wings
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which birds, but also, in a derogatory way, to ghosts and mediums produce high pitched sounds
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to vaunt oneself over|to claim to be greater than (someone else)
Node.definition: = state in which humans consider themselves more worthy of honor and respect than others and act accordingly
= wooden handle with an iron (בַּרְזֶל) blade, sharpened on one face, parallel to the handle; ► used for cutting down trees and shaping wood or stone

Node.gloss: to hew out|to dig|to cut out|to dress|to mine
Node.definition: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical

Node.gloss: to make oneself great|to show one's greatness|to magnify oneself
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities show others their elevated status, which they have, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= a flat tool with a serrated edge, sometimes fitted with a handle, ◄ made of either hard stone, such as flint, or metal; ► used for cutting objects in two
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= causative process by which humans take an object from a relatively low position and raise it up
= causative process by which humans take an object from a relatively low position and raise it up
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler; also used for threshing; ≈ associated with authority and punishment
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= causative action by which deities commission one or more people to go to a certain individual or place to inflict punishment
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
= state in which a fire (אֵשׁ) is burning up the combustible materials fueling it; ≈ associated with anger
= state in which a fire (אֵשׁ) is burning up the combustible materials fueling it
= state in which a fire (אֵשׁ) is burning up the combustible materials fueling it

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
= hot glowing body of fire (אֵשׁ) ≈ poetic
= process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= land that is suitable for agriculture ◄ as a result of fertility and sufficient rain

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
particle linking two objects, of which the first is not always listed explicitly; = relation indicating that object X and object Y are at opposite ends of a range of similar objects
= the physical body of humans and animals, not including the mind and the inner person
literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause heavy damage to objects to the extent that they are almost gone
literally: to melt; hence: = process by which people or objects to vanish from existence
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= state in which objects are relatively low in quantity, or in which events are relatively low in frequency
= causative action by which humans write down names or other information for record keeping purposes, without an explicit reference to a scroll or other writing materials

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which an action is repeated or continued

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= minute fragments; ◄ resulting from wearing down of esp. siliceous rocks and found covering parts of the sea shore, river beds, deserts, etc.; ► contains materials for the production of dye and glass; ≈ symbol of large quantity
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= literally: finishing; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
literally: to cut a decision; hence: = action by which humans or deities come to a formal and authoritative decision about something

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= literally: finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
literally: to cut a decision; hence: = action by which humans or deities come to a formal and authoritative decision about something
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler; also used for threshing; ≈ associated with authority and punishment
= causative action by which humans or forces take hold of objects and cause them to rise up from a certain location
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
literally: little fewness; hence: = a very short period of time

Node.gloss: to be finished|to be completed|to come to an end|to be past
Node.definition: = process by which an activity comes to full completion
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= action by which someone holds a tool and uses it
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal
= action by which an army inflicts many casualties on the army of the enemy
= man; ◄ son of Midian (מִדְיָן) son of Keturah (קְטוּרָה) wife of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name
= location; ◄ near the river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) in the territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► place where Oreb (עֹרֵב) chief of the Midianites (מִדְיָנִי) was killed by Gideon (גִּדְעֹון)
= man; ◄ chief of Midianites (מִדְיָנִי) defeated and killed by Gideon (גִּדְעֹון)
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler; also used for threshing; ≈ associated with authority and punishment
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= causative action by which humans or forces take hold of objects and cause them to rise up from a certain location
literally: road; hence: = action by which humans are travelling from one place to another
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans suffer hardship, ◄ described as a heavy burden that one is forced to carry
= the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= part of the body connecting the rump to the head; ► a ;place to wear ornaments, but also a yoke; ≈ a stiff neck is associated with insolence and pride

Node.gloss: to break > to bring to an end
Node.definition: literally: to break an event; hence: = causative action by which someone brings an event to an end

= bar or frame ◄ normally made of wood ► used to join two draft animals at the neck so that they can work together effectively in pulling a plow, threshing board, harrow, or wagon; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= oily substance found in the body of humans and animal
= town, probably to be identified with Ai (עַי) ◄ near Bethel (בֵּית־אֵל) territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם)
= town; ► territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)

Node.gloss: to put away|to store|to place (something)|to commit (someone)
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans put (other) humans or objects in a relatively safe location
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= a place where it is most practical to cross a mountain range
= town, possibly to be identified with Gibeah (גִּבְעָה) ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► given to Levites; home town of King Saul (שָׁאוּל)
= action when people or objects stay overnight in a certain place
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)

= town, possibly to be identified with Geba (גֶּבַע) ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► place where someone's concubine (פִּילֶגֶשׁ) was raped by a large group of men; home town of King Saul (שָׁאוּל)
= man; ◄ son of Kish (קִישׁ) tribe of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► first king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans shout ◄ for joy or because of grief ► to give vent to their feelings
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= location; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) north of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= location; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► for Levites
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= location; ◄ probably a few miles north of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► for priests (כֹּהֵן)

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= branches of tree

Node.gloss: to be high (in size)|to be tall
Node.definition: = state by which an object is of great and more than average height
= vertical height of an object
= causative action by which part of an object is violently removed from a larger unit, with the help of a sharp object, so that it falls to the ground
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status
= a dense growth of bushes or small trees that look intertwined; ► sometimes functions as a hiding place for animals
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
